input_text:
Job Title: Engineering Technician (3475) with Security Clearance

Location: Aiea, HI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Ghostrock, LLC a subsidiary of Three Saints Bay, LLC, and a federal government contractor is seeking an Engineering Technician to join the team in Norfolk, VA. This position can also be located in San Diego, CA. Position Overview: * Successful candidates will support NSWCPD in the development of Operating Sequencing Systems (OSS) for various operational ship classes. The purpose of OSS is to provide U.S. Navy and U.S. Coast Guard shipboard engineering personnel with technically correct, logically sequenced written procedures, charts, and diagrams tailored to each ship's specific configuration. OSS dictates the procedures to be followed to complete major plant status changes. The use of OSS ensures proper system and equipment operation and minimizes damage to equipment and injury to personnel. * Personnel supporting this effort are anticipated to participate in developing or updating Engineering OSS (EOSS), Aviation Fuel OSS (AFOSS), Sewage Disposal OSS (SDOSS), Catapult OSS (CATOSS), Catapult Lube Oil OSS (CLOSS), Cargo Fuel OSS (CFOSS), Deck OSS (DOSS), and OSS for Hull, Mechanical & Electric (HM&E) systems as required on U.S. Navy and U.S. Coast Guard steam, diesel, and gas turbine powered ships. * Successful candidates will participate in shipboard events during planned maintenance periods where shipboard configurations will be modified. Component, system or complete ship checks will be conducted to validate changes to OSS diagrams/procedures. Position Requirements: * High school, trade, industrial school, or GED equivalent. * Four (4) years of practical engineering experience in the operation, test, maintenance and repair of naval ship Hull, Mechanical, Electrical, Electronic, or Ordnance equipment and systems. * Two (2) years of experience developing/updating technical documentation for U.S. Navy ships systems and equipment. VEVRAA

Aiea, HI, United States Intelligence SME with Security Clearance Aiea HI 96701 United States 2024-04-18 8340_7511562 ClearanceJobs No Intelligence No https://click.appcast.io/track/icof6ib?cs=i8d&jg=20ym&bid=q948nGl57dNhZO5Va2AQmA==Amentum has an exciting opportunity for an Intelligence Subject Matter Expert to support the development of an Artificial Intelligence (AI)-enabled Joint Operational Planning Toolkit to support multi-domain, operational-level Course of Action (COA) development and COA analysis (aka wargaming) aimed at validating operational and contingency planning. This program, known as STORMBREAKER, is led by the INDOPACOM J5X. Essential Responsibilities: * Develop STORMBREAKER data repository in C2IE - SIPR * Develop entity (military unit) templates for STORMBREAKER repository * Develop AI Agents based on datasets and entities in the STORMBREAKER repository along with authoritative SME input on adjudication tables and military unit capabilities * Develop COA analysis output template * Design Transportation Feasibility Analysis Module * Integrate INDOPACOM OPLAN for wargame scenarios * Conduct test and evaluation of integrated STROMBREAKER capability Minimum Requirements: * Bachelor's Degree * Three years' experience as a military intelligence planner * Three years' experience in an operational support capacity (deployed in support of an operational unit) * Two years' experience as a planner at a three- or four-star level headquarters * At least two years of experience in the Indo-Pacific Area of Operations * Proficient at Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) * Must have an active Top-Secret US Government Clearance and be SCI eligibility. Note: US Citizenship is required to obtain a Top-Secret Clearance. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: * Master's Degree * Graduate of SAMS, JAWS, SAW, MAWS, or SAAS * Graduate of Senior Service School The salary range for this position is $130K to $150K (Salary to be determined by the education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant internal equity, and alignment with market data.) This position includes a competitive benefits package. For more detailed information on our Benefits and what it is like to work for Amentum: please visit our careers site: www.amentumcareers.com Amentum is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our hiring practices provide equal opportunity for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, gender, national origin, age, United States military veteran's status, ancestry, sexual orientation, marital status, family structure, medical condition including genetic characteristics or information, veteran status, or mental or physical disability so long as the essential functions of the job can be performed with or without reasonable accommodation, or any other protected category under federal, state, or local law. Labor Law Posters EEO including Disability/Protected Veterans 0.00 1007957 On-site

Amentum has an exciting opportunity for an Intelligence Subject Matter Expert to support the development of an Artificial Intelligence (AI)-enabled Joint Operational Planning Toolkit to support multi-domain, operational-level Course of Action (COA) development and COA analysis (aka wargaming) aimed at validating operational and contingency planning. This program, known as STORMBREAKER, is led by the INDOPACOM J5X. Essential Responsibilities: * Develop STORMBREAKER data repository in C2IE - SIPR * Develop entity (military unit) templates for STORMBREAKER repository * Develop AI Agents based on datasets and entities in the STORMBREAKER repository along with authoritative SME input on adjudication tables and military unit capabilities * Develop COA analysis output template * Design Transportation Feasibility Analysis Module * Integrate INDOPACOM OPLAN for wargame scenarios * Conduct test and evaluation of integrated STROMBREAKER capability Minimum Requirements: * Bachelor's Degree * Three years' experience as a military intelligence planner * Three years' experience in an operational support capacity (deployed in support of an operational unit) * Two years' experience as a planner at a three- or four-star level headquarters * At least two years of experience in the Indo-Pacific Area of Operations * Proficient at Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) * Must have an active Top-Secret US Government Clearance and be SCI eligibility. Note: US Citizenship is required to obtain a Top-Secret Clearance. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: * Master's Degree * Graduate of SAMS, JAWS, SAW, MAWS, or SAAS * Graduate of Senior Service School The salary range for this position is $130K to $150K (Salary to be determined by the education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant internal equity, and alignment with market data.) This position includes a competitive benefits package.
